Employers will further be required to remit Sh200 NSSF and Sh400 NHIF contributions for their domestic workers. 
Those who defy the regulations will be liable to a three-month jail term, a Sh50,000 fine, or both. 
Laws on domestic workers' pay were first introduced in 2011 following sustained pressure by the Central Oganisation of Trade Unions. 
Cotu cited inflation as the basis for the pay rise. 
The regulations have faced the challenge of follow-up as the Labour ministry lacks the capacity to monitor and enforce them. Kenya
